Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> So here's an ignorant question by yours truly. What's the different method SilentDragon is using and what's the extra layer of protection not using node.js?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> set your payout size larger

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and sweep funds into medium sized amounts

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Berg glad you asked

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> SilentDragon does not use web technology. Agama is essentially Chrome talking to your full node

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Luffy> @dukeleto  I was looking at Decker code and lost my head:rolf:  ... I'm looking at how it did with other assets. I will continue learning then:thinkaboutit:

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so SilentDragon is a bunch of C++, that I compile

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and it makes a binary, that you click on, to start

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> all the code it has is known when I compile it, before you start it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's "static"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the Agama wallet, that is Chrome!!!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> to make that, you have to use, literally, thousands of javascript packages

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Hush-NG was given to me, I inherited it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I am not a JS coder, by choice. I was given this, 10,000 lines of dependencies: https://github.com/MyHush/hush-ng/blob/master/package-lock.json

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> every time you run some commands, it gives you a new 10,000 lines of dependencies, slightly different, with slightly different versions and maybe some new, some removed. It's completely incomprehensible to see if some kind of malware has slipped in

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> You would have to read millions of lines of compacted unreadable code, which nobody does

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> also, nodeJS packages do not have to correspond to the code they show you on Github

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that itself, is mega scary

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> SilentDragon is older, more reliable, safer tech. Similar to OceanQT

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Luffy> Ohhhhh, The reading with link above ... I've screwed up:Surprised_Pikachu:

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Berg did i answer your question? I really do want us to explain this stuff to a wider audience

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if you can compile software, SilentDragon already exists

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> you can be on the bleeding edge with me. I need a few brave souls to crush bugs for bounties

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> Is SilentDragon a pre-existing package that you're modifying to run Hush? Or is this ground-up?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Luffy> @JWolf (WW Clan leader)  I think Hushmate works well with Z directions ... ????

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <heguli97> @Berg "SilentDragon is based on qt5. It's a fork of zecwallet: https://github.com/ZcashFoundation/zecwallet/releases "

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Luffy> We have theft epidemic again, it reminds me of 2015, when all the exchanges stolen every day

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Berg i am modifying zecwallet to the needs of Hush and to add HushList support. I build on top of zecwallet, it's not ground-up

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that means zcash foundation pays to support SilentDragon, because we pull in new code from zecwallet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> instead of Hush-NG, which I had to maintain completely alone

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> So SilentDragon is the Hush branding and revision?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> Did you come up with the name?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I am willing to pay bounties for short translations about this Agama hack, FYI. We need to tell people that don't speak English

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> @musicayfarandula  ^^^^^

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Berg the actual story is that radix42 made the SevenSeas Pirate wallet as a fork of zecwallet, and then modified it for Hush, named it SilentDragon and said "hey Duke, here you go, a fork of zecwallet". And I kind of liked the name, because Hush migrating to a Komodo chain is a "Silent Dragon". The name isn't written in stone, but also, "HushWallet" made me want to puke

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> then i went crazy and added a bunch of stuff to SilentDragon, like notarization height and coingecko price, and fixes rando bugs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> mostly SilentDragon needs a logo

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> a super dope dragon with Hush logo

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> We should put out a bounty on that ðŸ˜ƒ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> all super serious bugs are fixed, it's just branding. A logo at startup

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> Design contest?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and i am trying to change the color theme, because right now its boring as f

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> I also like the name, I was just curious if it was pre-existing as a wallet name for a coin other than Hush, just didn't know the origin

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but functionally, it's awesome

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we can migrate our translation files from Hush-NG to SilentDragon. They are not lost, just take a bit of work to migrate

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> right now silentdragon supports about 4 or 5 languages i think, via zecwallet
